metadata.Title: CVE-2023-34968 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A path disclosure vulnerability was found in Samba. As part of the Spotlight protocol, Samba discloses the server-side absolute path of shares, files, and directories in the results for search queries. This flaw allows a malicious client or an attacker with a targeted RPC request to view the information that is part of the disclosed path.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-34968` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ctdb - 2:4.15.13+dfsg-0ubuntu1.2
libnss-winbind - 2:4.15.13+dfsg-0ubuntu1.2
libpam-winbind - 2:4.15.13+dfsg-0ubuntu1.2
libsmbclient - 2:4.15.13+dfsg-0ubuntu1.2
libwbclient0 - 2:4.15.13+dfsg-0ubuntu1.2
python3-samba - 2:4.15.13+dfsg-0ubuntu1.2
registry-tools - 2:4.15.13+dfsg-0ubuntu1.2
samba - 2:4.15.13+dfsg-0ubuntu1.2
samba-common - 2:4.15.13+dfsg-0ubuntu1.2
samba-common-bin - 2:4.15.13+dfsg-0ubuntu1.2
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.15.13+dfsg-0ubuntu1.2
samba-libs - 2:4.15.13+dfsg-0ubuntu1.2
samba-testsuite - 2:4.15.13+dfsg-0ubuntu1.2
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.15.13+dfsg-0ubuntu1.2
smbclient - 2:4.15.13+dfsg-0ubuntu1.2
winbind - 2:4.15.13+dfsg-0ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> spotlight support was enabled in ubuntu packages in 2:4.13.2+dfsg-3ubuntu1 (Ubuntu 21.04 / hirsute) and in the 2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 backport to Ubuntu 20.04 LTS / focal. Older versions are not affected *unless* it is decided to backport a newer version to address other open security issues; see https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1950363 for details.

criterions.comment: samba package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:4.15.13+dfsg-0ubuntu1.2').
